data.question: What is the yield percentage of [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2] when basic iron acetate is reduced with excess Zn in CH3CN/AcOH?
What conditions lead to the formation of [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] with an 80% yield?
data.answer: Reduction of basic iron acetate in py/AcOH (10:1 or 5:1) affords [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] with an 80% yield.

data.question: What is the conversion rate of [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2] to [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] and [Zn(O2CCH3)2(py)2] in py or py/AcOH at -20 °C?
What is the effect of adding a large excess of Et2O to the py/AcOH reaction filtrates?
What is the structural feature of [Fe2.22(2)Zn0.78(2)O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py that distinguishes it from [Fe3O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py?
data.answer: [Fe2.22(2)Zn0.78(2)O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py is distinguished by its 1H NMR, 57Fe Mössbauer data (10% Fe(II)), and Fe/Zn ICP microanalyses.

data.question: What is the outcome of treating [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] and [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n with pure dioxygen or air?
What is the result of the reaction between [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2] and dioxygen in py/AcOH (2:1)?
data.answer: It yields red-black crystals of [Fe2.22(2)Zn0.78(2)O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py (95%) and colorless crystals of [Zn2(O2CCH3)4(py)2] (75%).

data.question: How does the presence of Et2O affect the equilibrium between [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4], [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n, and [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2]?
data.answer: The presence of Et2O shifts the pyridine-dependent equilibria in the order [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] → [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n → [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2].

data.question: What is the structural difference between [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] and [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n?
data.answer: [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] forms yellow-green crystals, while [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n forms yellow crystals occasionally contaminated with [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4], [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2], and [Zn(O2CCH3)2(py)2].

data.question: Is the reduction of basic iron acetate with Zn in neat pyridine capable of producing [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4]?
data.answer: Yes, the reduction of basic iron acetate with Zn in neat pyridine yields [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] (80%, −20 °C).

data.question: Does the reaction of [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2] with dioxygen always produce [Fe3O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py?
data.answer: False, the reaction of [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2] with dioxygen in py/AcOH (2:1) yields [Fe2.22(2)Zn0.78(2)O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py and [Zn2(O2CCH3)4(py)2].

data.question: Can [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] be obtained by treating basic iron acetate with iron dust?
data.answer: True, [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] can be obtained by treatment of basic iron acetate with iron dust or with H2 (30 psig)/Pd in py or py/AcOH (10:1).

data.question: Is [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n exclusively formed in py/AcOH solutions?
data.answer: False, [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n can also be formed from concentrated solutions of [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] in py/AcOH (5:1, 2:1) upon addition of Et2O.

data.question: Does the addition of Et2O to the py/AcOH reaction filtrates exclusively favor the formation of [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4]?
data.answer: False, the addition of a large excess of Et2O to the py/AcOH reaction filtrates favors the formation of [Zn2FeII(O2CCH3)6(py)2].

data.question: Is the conversion of [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] and [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n to [Fe3O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py irreversible?
data.answer: True, upon exposure of their py or py/AcOH solutions to pure dioxygen or air, both [FeII(O2CCH3)2(py)4] and [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n are quantitatively converted to [Fe3O(O2CCH3)6(py)3]·py.

data.question: Can [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n be directly obtained by reducing basic iron acetate with Zn in py/AcOH?
data.answer: False, [FeII2(O2CCH3)4(py)3]n is obtained from the diffusion of Et2O into the original py/AcOH filtrates at 10 °C, not directly from the reduction.
